result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S Hergert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(clerked by RW)
Defendant Christopher S Hergert in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Defendant Christopher S Hergert in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14TR2565, 15CM44, 15CM305, 15CM482 and 16CF10. 
14TR2565 - Court orders case be dismissed 
15CM44- Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Court dismisses count 2. Court orders counts 3 and 4 be dismissed and read-in. 
15CM305 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
15CM482 - Court orders this case be dismissed and read-in. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

15CM44: Court relates and orders: 
110 days jail with Huber. 
30 Month Drivers License Revocation
30 Month IID
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
$3214.00 fine inclusive of costs - Bond in 15CM482 & 15CM305 to be applied. 60 days to pay balance or set up a payment plan. 
.128 BAC 

15CM305: Court relates and orders:
20 days jail with Huber consecutive to 15CM44. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan. 

 Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.    

16CF10 - Time limits waived. Preliminary hearing/Arraignment scheduled before Judge Boyle on 2/9/16 at 3:30 PM. 
Defense requests bond be reduced from a $1000.00 cash bond to a $5000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Court grants. All other conditions remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Christopher S Hergert in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Defendant Christopher S Hergert in custody.  John M. O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CM44, 15CM305, 15CM482 AND 16CF10. 
16CF10 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton to represent on this file for now. If financial status changes, Defendant is to contact public defender's office. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint. 
Attorney Sutton will contact Branch 1 or 2 to see if all of these cases can be scheduled for a plea on Monday, January 11, 2016. In the meantime, all files set for 1/14/16 at 9:00 a.m. for 30 minutes.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
COVERS 15CM44, 15CM305, 15CM482 - Attorney fees $100.00 by wage assignment to continue - Laura Sutton

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191. 

  This is an ADDITION to previous bond  $ posted.


  Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
  Must submit to daily PBTs at Cameron PD  at 6PM.

Defendant Christopher S Hergert in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court appoints Laura Sutton.

15CM305 & 15CM44 also called.

  Plea hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.
